Header: China’s annual congress kicks off, Premier Li says China facing “complex and severe situation”
Content: Delegates to China’s largely rubber-stamp parliament assembled in Beijing as the annual session of the National Peoples’ Congress got underway.The session begins amidst simmering US-Sino trade tensions, and concerns about a slowdown in the Chinese economy. Premier Li Keqiang opened his annual work report by stressing that China is facing an “exceptional, complex and severe situation, and the economy is facing new downward pressure”. Around 3,000 hand-picked delegates have gathered at the Soviet-style Great Hall of the People for the opening. Lawmakers are expected to rubber-stamp the government’s proposals during the parliament session.
